result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn N Krenzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Huber granted for work if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations. Take all medications as prescribed. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

records.addlTxt: The def failed to appear for his PSI interview

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shawn N Krenzke in court with Attorney Keith David O'Donnell. Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Defendant is now present and request the court vacate the warrant and set his matter for a Sentencing hearing.
St- Request the bond be modified to a $1,000 cash bond.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT. Bond modified to $1,000 cash bond, all other conditions to remain. Reorder a PSI. **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.**

Attorney Keith David O'Donnell in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Defendant never appeared for the PSI interview.

Defendant taken into custody and bond set. RCJ called Dispatch to cancel the warrant. Dispatch called Jennifer/warrants to verify it could be canceled due to appearance in court. Dispatch will cancel and return the original warrant to the courts.

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC-2nd + Offense). Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
